children.text: Convent of Santa Caterina di Siena (Via Larga, now Via Cavour). Founded in 1500, at the expense of Santa Lucia (beata), the former wife of Ridolfo Rucellai, who had become a monk through Savon-arola's preaching. It was suppressed in 1808, and was associated with the Accademia di Belle Arti. At present it is occupied by schools and laboratories. [Trans.]
